info.title: FinAegis Core Banking API
info.description: Open Source Core Banking as a Service - A modern, scalable, and secure core banking platform built with Laravel 12, featuring 41 DDD domains, event sourcing, CQRS, cross-chain bridges, DeFi protocol integration, privacy-preserving identity, RegTech compliance, Banking-as-a-Service, and AI-powered analytics.

post.summary: Query transactions using natural language or structured filters
post.description: Accepts a natural language query and/or structured filters to search transactions. The NLP engine parses intent and entities from the query, builds filters, and returns matching transactions with a natural language summary.

query.example: Show me all payments over $500 last month

nl_summary.example: Found 15 transactions totaling $7,500 in the last month

post.summary: Analyze spending patterns by category, merchant, and time
post.description: Uses AI to analyze spending patterns from transaction history. Accepts natural language queries or structured filters to segment spending by category, merchant, and time period.

query.example: What did I spend on food this quarter?

data.description: Spending analysis breakdown by category, merchant, and time period

post.summary: Sign a UserOperation with authentication shard
post.description:
Sign a UserOperation hash with the server's authentication shard.

This endpoint is used by mobile apps to get the server's signature
for ERC-4337 UserOperations. The mobile app must provide:
- The UserOperation hash (computed client-side)
- A proof from the device's key shard
- A biometric authentication token

The server validates the biometric token and signs with its auth shard.
The mobile app then combines both signatures for the final UserOp.

Selects the best available bridge quote and initiates the cross-chain transfer from sender to recipient address.

post.description: Gets a combined bridge + swap quote for swapping tokens across different chains. The quote includes bridge fees, swap fees, estimated output, and execution time.
Executes a cross-chain token swap by first obtaining the best quote and then executing the bridge + swap operations for the given wallet address.

parameters.description: Cursor for pagination (opaque string from previous response)

parameters.description: Number of items per page (1-50, default 20)

get.summary: Get the status of all supported payment networks
get.description: Returns the current availability and health status of all supported payment networks (e.g., Solana, Tron). Useful for checking network congestion or downtime before initiating payments.

post.description: Creates a payment intent for a merchant transaction. Supports idempotency via X-Idempotency-Key header or body field. The intent must be submitted separately to authorize payment.

parameters.name: X-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: Idempotency key to prevent duplicate payments

422.description: Validation error or payment intent creation failed

get.description: Retrieves the current status and details of a payment intent by its ID.

post.summary: Submit and authorize a payment intent
post.description: Submits a pending payment intent for authorization. The user must authenticate via biometric or PIN before the payment is processed on-chain.

422.description: Payment intent cannot be submitted (invalid state)

message.example: Intent is not in a submittable state.

post.description: Cancels a pending payment intent. An optional reason can be provided for auditing purposes.

422.description: Payment intent cannot be cancelled (invalid state)

message.example: Intent is not in a cancellable state.

post.summary: Generate a receipt for a transaction
post.description: Generates a digital receipt for a confirmed transaction. Receipts can only be generated for transactions that have been confirmed on-chain.

422.description: Receipt cannot be generated (transaction not confirmed)

message.example: Receipt can only be generated for confirmed transactions.

get.description: Retrieves the full details of a transaction including on-chain status, merchant info, amount, and fees.

parameters.description: End date for usage history (defaults to today)

get.description: Returns the partner's current branding configuration used for white-label widgets, including colors, logos, and company information.

put.description: Updates the partner's branding configuration for white-label widgets. All fields are optional; only provided fields will be updated.

get.description: Returns a catalog of all available third-party integrations that partners can enable, organized by category (KYC, payments, analytics, etc.).
Returns a list of integrations currently enabled for the authenticated partner, including their configuration and status.

post.description: Enables a third-party integration for the partner. Requires specifying the category and provider, with optional configuration parameters.

422.description: Integration cannot be enabled (invalid provider or tier restriction)

error.example: Provider not available for your tier

delete.description: Disables a previously enabled integration by its ID. The integration's configuration is preserved for potential re-enablement.

post.description: Performs a connectivity test against the specified integration to verify that API keys and configuration are valid.

get.description: Returns a health status overview of all enabled integrations, including uptime, error rates, and last successful connection timestamps.
Returns a list of programming languages for which SDKs can be generated.
